text: Dronacharya Group of Institution (also known as DGI, Greater Noida) situated in Greater Noida, NCR, India. The institute is approved by All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India and affiliated to Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam Technical University which is one of the biggest universities in the state of Uttar Pradesh. ==History== The institute was established in 2006 under the aegis of Smt. Anguri Devi Charitable Trust (Regd.). ==Campus== DGI's campus, spread over 10 acres, is situated at Knowledge Park, Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh. The Institute has more than 60 laboratories and a central library which has more than 3800 books and national and international journals. ==Recognition== *Mechanical Engineering department of Institute is selected in Platinum Category in AICTE – CII Survey of Industry-linked Technical Institutes 2016. *5 star rated Remote Center of IIT Bombay / IIT Kharagpur to conduct various ISTE workshops under NMEICT project. *Remote Center of NITTTR Chandigarh to conduct various ICT workshops *Resource Centre of IIT Bombay for Spoken Tutorial and FOSS. *Nodal Center for Virtual labs IIT Delhi and setup of Virtual lab on Control System *NPTEL for Online Courses: Active Local Chapter and selected in Top 100 Local Chapters of NPTEL. *QEEE for D2S Program : (Partners Category) in sync with the IITs. ==Courses offered== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Admissions to the first year of B.Tech. are based on the performance in the UPSEE & JEE-MAINS EXAMS . Candidates who have passed Intermediate of C.B.S.E. Board or (10+2) standard from other board are eligible for such an admission. Candidates are also admitted to the second year of B.Tech. through lateral entry. For securing such admission, the candidate should have passed 3/4 year diploma (with minimum 60% marks).
